comments.body:
@xmudrii -- One stylistic nit, which does not need to be addressed, it's just a tip for future PRs...

When you change artifact locations, try to do so as a separate commit; it makes it easier to track down, edit, or remove (if you need to later).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +69,73 @@            downloaded_file_path = "cri_tools.tgz",
            sha256 = sha,
            urls = mirror("https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cri-tools/releases/download/v%s/crictl-v%s-%s.tar.gz" % (CRI_TOOLS_VERSION, CRI_TOOLS_VERSION, arch)),
        )

comments.body: Is the bucket only available there or would `gcr.io/‚Ä¶` work too?

@saschagrunert -- `gcr.io/...` would _NOT_ work.
`us.gcr.io` is one of the geo-specific endpoints images are promoted into (the others being `{eu,asia}.gcr.io).

Once the vanity domain flip (VDF) is complete (sometime in May), `k8s.gcr.io` will geo-target the appropriate endpoints.

We will then sweep references to `us.gcr.io/k8s-artifacts-prod/<staging-project>` and revert them to `k8s.gcr.io`.

More details: https://github.com/kubernetes/k8s.io/blob/master/k8s.gcr.io/Vanity-Domain-Flip.md
Tracking issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/release/issues/270
That helps, thank you for the clarification üôè

# Dependencies needed for a Kubernetes "release", e.g. building docker images,

comments.body: this technically isn't a "release dependency" - I think it's only used for the integration test - but I guess it doesn't really matter.
Also it seems like this PR can be in its own PR too, right?
it can, but it probably belongs here since it's specific to making multi-arch work.
Smaller commits are much faster to review and merge.

comments.body: I'm ok with this, but being honest... I don't think this should live in bazel.
I want to decouple bazel from the artifact generation.

This change _just_ minimizes it down to ~ one place in bazel, which should be strictly better than the n places we had before. It definitely doesn't solve anything else.

It will be easier to derive it from another source later now that it is not hardcoded in many places. 
We could have a rule read it in from some other format. Or we can generate deb / rpm with another tool / set of rules or ....

Will leave that up to future PRs. Direction there seems pretty TBD and I'm low on bandwidth atm.
Agree we're in a better place now rather than before. We could experiment with one central place for ~all well-known deps
